channel.title: CVE Feed for Siemens -- SINUMERIK 828D V4
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Siemens -- SINUMERIK 828D V4

item.title: CVE-2024-41171|2024-09-10T15:03:16.367Z -- siemens -- sinumerik%20828d%20v4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in SINUMERIK 828D V4 (All versions), SINUMERIK 828D V5 (All versions < V5.24), SINUMERIK 840D sl V4 (All versions), SINUMERIK ONE (All versions < V6.24). Affected devices do not properly enforce access restrictions to scripts that are regularly executed by the system with elevated privileges. This could allow an authenticated local attacker to escalate their privileges in the underlying system.

item.title: CVE-2024-43781|2024-09-10T09:36:51.143Z -- siemens -- sinumerik%20828d%20v4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in SINUMERIK 828D V4 (All versions < V4.95 SP3), SINUMERIK 840D sl V4 (All versions < V4.95 SP3 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V4.8 SP1 HF6), SINUMERIK ONE (All versions < V6.23 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V6.6), SINUMERIK ONE (All versions < V6.15 SP4 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V6.6). Affected systems, that have been provisioned with Create MyConfig (CMC), contain a Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File vulnerability. This could allow a local authenticated user with low privileges to read sensitive information and thus circumvent access restrictions.

item.title: CVE-2024-41171|2024-09-10T09:36:46.244Z -- siemens -- sinumerik%20828d%20v4

Affected devices do not properly enforce access restrictions to scripts that are regularly executed by the system with elevated privileges. This could allow an authenticated local attacker to escalate their privileges in the underlying system.

item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in SINUMERIK 828D V4 (All versions < V4.95 SP3), SINUMERIK 840D sl V4 (All versions < V4.95 SP3 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V4.8 SP1 HF6), SINUMERIK ONE (All versions < V6.23 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V6.6), SINUMERIK ONE (All versions < V6.15 SP4 in connection with using Create MyConfig (CMC) <= V6.6). Affected systems, that have been provisioned with Create MyConfig (CMC), contain a Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File vulnerability. This could allow a local authenticated user with low privileges to read sensitive information and thus circumvent access restrictions.
